intro: Allium helleri, commonly known as the Sierra onion, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring basal leaves that are linear and often covered in a powdery coating. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale purple flowers during the spring and early summer. Its bulbs are edible and have a mild, onion-like flavor, making it useful in culinary applications. Allium helleri thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or alpine environments.
